content.description: Crimp up to possible dyno out to horizontal flake (will test security on cleaning). Great feet to end
Easy side pulls up to large edges, overcome the fear of the crap landing to pull through top.

Start with both hands on the vertical crack in the small cave area.  Move up to two large jugs accompanied by an optional side pull jug.  Make a dynamic move to the jug rail in the center of the face and then make another large move to jugs on the lip of the topout.  Great climb and very safe unlike most of the climbs in Back Alley.

 Also this climb isn't technically really part of Back Alley and if anyone knows a better location for it (potentially furthest left side of Fern Buttress?) let me know and I will get it moved on here.
content.protection: Two pads or one pad and someone to move it.  Very safe climb.
content.location: This climb is located out right past the Back Alley immediately after a break in the cliff face.  It can be difficult to see from the path because it is hidden behind the Abominable Boulder and another mossy boulder without any climbs. To the left of this climb are a few concrete structures where the cliff line breaks.

content.description: Start low on slab section, mantle up midway to long moves and lockoffs.

Nice tunnel behind the Abominable Boulder with slab to overhanging boulder problems.

 For more information, check out the MRG Pocket Guide created by Cole Musial: MRG Pocket Guide
